messageBody:
Hello,

I am new to Junit, I'm starting with Junit 4.
I wanted to define an abstract base class
establishing required steps for a test, but I
see that methods defined in subclasses don't know what annotations
are attached to corresponding signatures in a parent class.
(only class level annotation inheritance)

I wanted something like:
public abstract class ApiTestBase
{
@BeforeClass abstract void suiteSetup() throws Exception;
@Before abstract void preTest() throws Exception;
@Test abstract void Run() throws Exception;
@After abstract void postTest() throws Exception;
@AfterClass abstract void suiteTearDown() throws Exception;
}
so that the subclass would just have to implement the
required methods without having to explicitly re-annotate.

Is there a workaround?

-E.S.
